alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 28 at 1:25PM MST until December 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the High Wind Watch, west winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the High Wind Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers between mile markers 240 and 290 on Interstate 80. Patchy to areas of blowing snow from recent snowfall could reduce visibility to less than a half mile at times.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
